article.title: Effective field theory of statistical anisotropies for primordial bispectrum and gravitational waves

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the main topic of the article?
choices: The observational evidence for anisotropic inflation.
Using effective field theory to study statistical anisotropies in anisotropic inflation.
A comparison of anisotropic inflation with standard single-field inflation.

multiple_choice_question.text: What kind of perturbations are studied in the article?
choices: Scalar and tensor perturbations, but not vector perturbations.

multiple_choice_question.text: What are some of the quantities calculated in the article?
choices: The anisotropies in scalar power spectrum and bispectrum.
The statistical anisotropy in tensor power spectrum.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is a key feature of the EFT approach used in the article?
choices: It incorporates anisotropies generated in models with non-trivial speed for both gauge field and scalar perturbations.
It ignores the gauge field and focuses only on the inflaton field.
It relies on direct observations of anisotropic inflation.
It is only applicable to models with parity violation.
